TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of MSH.3 to MessageHeader.source with a valid source application.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: MessageHeader resource should contain the source element with the application name extracted from MSH.3.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with MSH.3 populated with a valid application name (e.g., 'ApplicationA').
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR MessageHeader resource.
Validate that the MessageHeader.source.display contains 'ApplicationA'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The MessageHeader resource must contain the source element with the correct application name from MSH.3. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of missing MSH.3 in MessageHeader.source mapping.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: MessageHeader resource should either not contain the source element or contain a default/error message indicating the missing source.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with MSH.3 empty.
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR MessageHeader resource.
Validate that the MessageHeader.source is either absent or contains an error message/default value.
Verify if error logs/warnings are generated for missing source.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The MessageHeader resource must either not contain the source element or contain a default/error message. Error logs/warnings should indicate the missing source. If the output and logs are correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Regression test to ensure MSH.3 to MessageHeader.source mapping continues to function correctly after system updates.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: MessageHeader resource should contain the source element with the application name extracted from MSH.3.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with MSH.3 populated with a valid application name (e.g., 'ApplicationB').
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR MessageHeader resource using the updated system.
Validate that the MessageHeader.source contains 'ApplicationB'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The MessageHeader resource must contain the source element with the correct application name from MSH.3. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify mapping of MSH.3 to MessageHeader.source with a long application name exceeding typical lengths.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: MessageHeader resource should contain the source element with the full (truncated if necessary) application name from MSH.3.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with MSH.3 populated with a very long application name (e.g., a string of 256 characters).
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR MessageHeader resource.
Validate that the MessageHeader.source contains the application name, either fully or truncated as per system specifications.
Check for any truncation warnings or errors in the logs.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The MessageHeader resource must contain the application name (either full or truncated). No critical errors should be logged due to length. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of PID.3 to Patient.identifier with a valid patient identifier.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain an identifier with the value from PID.3 and system 'http://external-hospital.org/patient-ids'.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.3 populated with a valid identifier (e.g., '12345').
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.identifier[0].value contains '12345' and Patient.identifier[0].system contains 'http://external-hospital.org/patient-ids'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain an identifier with the correct value and system. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of missing PID.3 in Patient.identifier mapping.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should either not contain the identifier or contain a default/error message indicating the missing identifier.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.3 empty.
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.identifier is either absent or contains an error message/default value.
Verify if error logs/warnings are generated for missing identifier.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must either not contain the identifier or contain a default/error message. Error logs/warnings should indicate the missing identifier. If the output and logs are correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Regression test to ensure PID.3 to Patient.identifier mapping continues to function correctly after system updates.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain an identifier with the value from PID.3 and system 'http://external-hospital.org/patient-ids'.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.3 populated with a valid identifier (e.g., '67890').
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource using the updated system.
Validate that the Patient.identifier[0].value contains '67890' and Patient.identifier[0].system contains 'http://external-hospital.org/patient-ids'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain an identifier with the correct value and system. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify mapping of PID.3 to Patient.identifier with a long identifier exceeding typical lengths.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain the identifier with the full (truncated if necessary) identifier from PID.3.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.3 populated with a very long identifier (e.g., a string of 256 characters).
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.identifier[0].value contains the identifier, either fully or truncated as per system specifications.
Check for any truncation warnings or errors in the logs.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain the identifier (either full or truncated). No critical errors should be logged due to length. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of PID.5 to Patient.name with valid name components.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain a name with family and given names extracted from PID.5.1 and PID.5.2 respectively.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.5.1 populated with a family name (e.g., 'Smith') and PID.5.2 populated with a given name (e.g., 'John').
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.name[0].family contains 'Smith' and Patient.name[0].given contains 'John'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain a name with the correct family and given names. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of missing PID.5 in Patient.name mapping.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should either not contain the name element or contain a default/error message indicating the missing name.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.5 empty.
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.name is either absent or contains an error message/default value.
Verify if error logs/warnings are generated for missing name.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must either not contain the name element or contain a default/error message. Error logs/warnings should indicate the missing name. If the output and logs are correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Regression test to ensure PID.5 to Patient.name mapping continues to function correctly after system updates.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain a name with family and given names extracted from PID.5.1 and PID.5.2 respectively.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.5.1 populated with a family name (e.g., 'Jones') and PID.5.2 populated with a given name (e.g., 'Jane').
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource using the updated system.
Validate that the Patient.name[0].family contains 'Jones' and Patient.name[0].given contains 'Jane'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain a name with the correct family and given names. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify mapping of PID.5 to Patient.name with special characters in name components.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain a name with family and given names containing special characters from PID.5.1 and PID.5.2 respectively.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.5.1 populated with a family name containing special characters (e.g., 'O'Brien') and PID.5.2 populated with a given name containing special characters (e.g., 'Zoë').
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.name[0].family contains 'O'Brien' and Patient.name[0].given contains 'Zoë'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain a name with the correct family and given names, including special characters. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of PID.8 to Patient.gender with valid gender codes.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain the gender element with the corresponding FHIR code based on the HL7 gender code in PID.8.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.8 populated with 'M'.
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender contains 'male'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain the gender element with the correct FHIR code based on the HL7 gender code. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of PID.8 to Patient.gender with valid gender codes.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain the gender element with the corresponding FHIR code based on the HL7 gender code in PID.8.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.8 populated with 'F'.
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender contains 'female'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain the gender element with the correct FHIR code based on the HL7 gender code. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of PID.8 to Patient.gender with valid gender codes.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain the gender element with the corresponding FHIR code based on the HL7 gender code in PID.8.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.8 populated with 'U'.
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender contains 'unknown'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain the gender element with the correct FHIR code based on the HL7 gender code. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of invalid PID.8 value in Patient.gender mapping.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should either not contain the gender element or contain a default/error message indicating the invalid gender code.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.8 populated with 'X' (an invalid gender code).
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender is either absent or contains an error message/default value.
Verify if error logs/warnings are generated for the invalid gender code.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must either not contain the gender element or contain a default/error message. Error logs/warnings should indicate the invalid gender code. If the output and logs are correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of missing PID.8 in Patient.gender mapping.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should either not contain the gender element or contain a default/error message indicating the missing gender code.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.8 empty.
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender is either absent or contains an error message/default value.
Verify if error logs/warnings are generated for missing gender code.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must either not contain the gender element or contain a default/error message. Error logs/warnings should indicate the missing gender code. If the output and logs are correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Regression test to ensure PID.8 to Patient.gender mapping continues to function correctly after system updates.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain the gender element with the corresponding FHIR code based on the HL7 gender code in PID.8.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.8 populated with 'M'.
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource using the updated system.
Validate that the Patient.gender contains 'male'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain the gender element with the correct FHIR code based on the HL7 gender code. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify case-insensitivity of PID.8 to Patient.gender mapping.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Patient resource should contain the gender element with the corresponding FHIR code regardless of the case of the HL7 gender code in PID.8.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with PID.8 populated with 'm'.
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Patient resource.
Validate that the Patient.gender contains 'male'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Patient resource must contain the gender element with the correct FHIR code, even with a lowercase HL7 gender code. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify successful mapping of OBX.3 to Observation.code with valid observation codes.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Observation resource should contain the code element with the mapped LOINC code from OBX.3.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with OBX.3 populated with a valid observation code (e.g., a LOINC code like '8302-2').
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Observation resource.
Validate that the Observation.code.coding[0].code contains the mapped LOINC code based on the vocab_mappings.
Validate that the Observation.code.coding[0].system contains 'http://loinc.org'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Observation resource must contain the code element with the correct mapped LOINC code. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of missing OBX.3 in Observation.code mapping.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Observation resource should either not contain the code element or contain a default/error message indicating the missing observation code.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with OBX.3 empty.
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Observation resource.
Validate that the Observation.code is either absent or contains an error message/default value.
Verify if error logs/warnings are generated for missing observation code.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Observation resource must either not contain the code element or contain a default/error message. Error logs/warnings should indicate the missing observation code. If the output and logs are correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify handling of invalid OBX.3 value in Observation.code mapping.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Observation resource should either not contain the code element or contain a default/error message indicating the invalid observation code.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with OBX.3 populated with an invalid observation code (e.g., 'INVALID_CODE').
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Observation resource.
Validate that the Observation.code is either absent or contains an error message/default value.
Verify if error logs/warnings are generated for the invalid observation code.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Observation resource must either not contain the code element or contain a default/error message. Error logs/warnings should indicate the invalid observation code. If the output and logs are correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Regression test to ensure OBX.3 to Observation.code mapping continues to function correctly after system updates.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Observation resource should contain the code element with the mapped LOINC code from OBX.3.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with OBX.3 populated with a valid observation code (e.g., a LOINC code like '29463-7').
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Observation resource using the updated system.
Validate that the Observation.code.coding[0].code contains the mapped LOINC code.
Validate that the Observation.code.coding[0].system contains 'http://loinc.org'.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Observation resource must contain the code element with the correct mapped LOINC code. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.

TestCases.TestDescription: Verify mapping of OBX.3 to Observation.code with a long observation code exceeding typical lengths.
TestCases.ExpectedOutput: Observation resource should contain the code element with the full (truncated if necessary) observation code from OBX.3.
TestSteps: Provide an HL7 message with OBX.3 populated with a very long observation code (e.g., a string of 256 characters).
Transform the HL7 message to a FHIR Observation resource.
Validate that the Observation.code.coding[0].code contains the observation code, either fully or truncated as per system specifications.
Check for any truncation warnings or errors in the logs.
TestCases.PassFailCriteria: The Observation resource must contain the observation code (either full or truncated). No critical errors should be logged due to length. If correct, the test passes; otherwise, it fails.
